arts.ttl: Atalanta Suffer Massive Injury Scare in Bologna Draw
arts.sum: Problems keep piling up for Atalanta at the start of the new campaign as Marco Brescianini faces a potentially lengthy spell on the sidelines. The former Frosinone midfielder picked up an injury during Saturday's 1-1 draw against Bologna at Renato Dall'Ara. The post Atalanta Suffer Massive Injury Scare in Bologna Draw appeared first on The Cult of Calcio.

arts.ttl: Italiano Hails Bologna Spirit After Painful Atalanta Draw
arts.sum: Bologna head coach Vincenzo Italiano couldn't believe his misfortune after Atalanta grabbed a late equalizer to hold his side to a 1-1 draw last night. A dramatic contest at Renato Dall'Ara saw the 10-man Rossoblu fight stoically until the 90th minute when Lazar Samaradzic canceled out Santiago Castro's second-half opener. The post Italiano Hails Bologna Spirit After Painful Atalanta Draw appeared first on The Cult of Calcio.

arts.ttl: Atalanta boss Gian Piero Gasperini after draw against 10-men Bologna: “We never managed to capitalise”
arts.sum: Serie A side Atalanta failed to beat Bologna today, despite the fact that the Rossoblu were down to ten men in the game. Jhon Lucumi was sent off for Bologna…

arts.ttl: Bologna’s Italiano: “We take home the spirit of our players”
arts.sum: Following Bologna’s 1-1 draw with Atalanta in the sixth round of Serie A, head coach Vincenzo Italiano shared his thoughts on the match in an interview with Sky Sport. Italiano began by highlighting the positive aspects of the game: “We take home the spirit of our players from the moment we were reduced to ten men. I’ve experienced this before against Atalanta, and it’s difficult because they keep enveloping you and throwing you into the penalty area. I decided to focus on the result and the standings. arts.ttl: Atalanta’s Gasperini rues Bologna draw: “We lacked clarity”
arts.sum: Atalanta manager Gian Piero Gasperini reflected on his team’s 1-1 draw against Bologna, where a late goal from Lazar Samardzic salvaged a point for the Nerazzurri. The result helped Atalanta avoid a second consecutive defeat in the league following their loss to Como. In his post-match interview with Sky Sport, Gasperini began by assessing the overall performance: “We played a good game, even in the first half. We undoubtedly had a good match. We lacked clarity when we had many attackers on the field and they were down to 10 men. We were also a bit unlucky. arts.ttl: Bologna Chief Reiterates Belief in Italiano Amid Stuttering Start
arts.sum: Bologna sporting director Marco Di Vaio has reiterated the club's trust in new manager Vincenzo Italiano despite an underwhelming start. The former striker likes Italiano's approach but understands it'll take time to implement his ideas at Renato Dall'Ara. arts.ttl: Serie A | Bologna 1-1 Atalanta: Match Report
arts.sum: In a thrilling Serie A encounter at the Stadio Dall’Ara, Atalanta managed to secure a 1-1 draw against Bologna, thanks to a stunning late goal from Lazar Samardzic. The match was marked by dramatic turns, with Bologna taking the lead early in the second half before being reduced to 10 men. ## First Half Highlights The first half saw both teams creating opportunities, with Santiago Castro’s diving header going wide for Bologna and Ademola Lookman being denied by an impressive save from Lukasz Skorupski.
